text: PRIMO MESSAGGIO DI TEST THE CHAT ROOM!
FIRST TEST MESSAGE ON THE CHAT ROOM!
who will be the first user to post a message? let's see....
Wow, congratulations F... it looks amazing!
si torna ai vecchi tempi di irc :D
back to old irc good days (●__●)
Ciao Frank ti ho trovato veccghia volpe
vado a cena, a tra pocoo!!! dinner time!
Oh man. Bringing me back to web based IRC days. NOICE!
ahaha thank you Varx, i'm enjoying it too, missing the 90's :D
tnx VA2PTL, Let's bring the real chat back to life!
changi nickname to see if i get a better color... (yes, nickname color is randomized based on your nick!)
ok, a little better... i'll implemente more thing soon hopefully
Varx: i did a bit of input sanitization, maybe i should improve it more
Yeah probably want to escape out micron. Else \n>> We can do whatever we want format-wise
it escapes almost all in the nickanme, less in the messages
will improve all things soon, just launched in beta
IK5FKA grazie!! si, prende l'orario dal server, puoi usare il comando /time per vedere la differenza tra l'ora del server e l'ora tua
yeah i need to escape micron in the messages...
Ok.. ah vedo che se faccio il reload mi sparisce il nickname sopra la riga messaggio
Nice! Just trying to beat the skiddies. Can you tell my dayjob is appsec?
si perchè il reload normale non passa il parametro username dal campo di input, per la persistenza bisogna usare il link reload al fianco dei messaggi, oppure il send
Ci vorrebbero i topics, le stanze, rooms, channels... :-)
eh...molto molto complicato, purtroppo micron non permette di fare nulla di grande...forse sul topic ci posso lavorare, ottima idea :D
non avevo visto il bottone reload...
i need to implement more appealing colors for the nicknames :D
Si usano i soliti tag di micron? Quelli che sto imparando per le pagine?
per ora si, nei messaggi, ma devo filtrarli perchè se non usati correttamente (aperti e chiusi) possono alterare tutta la pagina
anzi, devo iniziare a lavorarci subito!!
ecco, avevi attivato il corsivo per tutta la pagina:D
For non italian users: excuse us for talking in Italian...
Infatti. Ma resterà un po' di nicchia se non ci sono interfacce amichevoli per gli end users...
yeah we need a nomadnet browser on sideband...maybe it will come soon!
I'm off to eat, God bless.
i quit guys, see you soon, thanks for visitin this room! :)
* Franky has quit (Connection Reset by peer) :D
added chatroom topic, freely editable from all user (for the moment)
Awesome stuff, chatting through an RNode !
Good Night Reticulum People!!! See You Tomorrow!
Hello everyone! ;) (added >>THE CHAT ROOM!<< to my links)
Hi Luke, Hi Doom, hello Chat :))
ok, perfect, all user input are skipping B009 ! * backticks to avoid micron injection :)
if anyone find bugs is welcome to write to: 0d051f3b6f844380c3e0c5d14e37fac8

Seriously, this has to be the most useful tool for communities without Internet access. Congratulations on being the first to bring this functionality to Reticulum! Very happy to be part of the userbase! Pretty sure making this open-source would get a lot of attention! Thank you for your efforts!
tnx! i think i will put it on github when fully ready, there is big improvement possibility here...new ideas are coming :)
What's up everyone? What's up Franky? Digging the irc vibes
So anybody else in South Florida got an rnode? I've been testing with my own equipment, so far no local announces.
OO yay group chat,  I havent seen these since the early 2000s
Good morning chat room! Cold winter morning in Cape Town!
hey laptop, take a look on rmap.world to see if there are neibhour nodes!
I checked, everyone is far away. That's fine, I think most ppl who use these devices are most likely on meshtastic around here.
Does anyone know why a lot of Nomadnet Nodes announce very often, but whenever I try to browse their content they are not available?
For example, X-MESH, which is 2 hops away, just announced 2 minutes ago but is unreachable right now. It has been available on and off, like many other Nodes, even if it constantly announces.
This ChatRoom, 2 hops away as well, is always available.
X-MESH is accessible, it seems random.

XMesh not available for me for 20 minutes, now 4 hops away. Maybe this could be explained by the fact the mesh requires some time to self-heal, while a lot of test nodes may go online/offline regularily beacuse many people are just testing.
So maybe we get routed through some node for a while... and when this node goes down, it takes a while to get a new route that reaches our destination?

hi guys! va2ptl, i have only 2 explanations for this, 1 node or page is in maintenance so not working atm, 2 do you have the latest version of rns and nomadnet? new releases talks only with new releases due to crypt algo change
yes, i suggest to stay updated with all rns packages, new releases are not compatible with old releases due to this major update of aes256
i wrote a python script to check updates and download new versions if needed, it's called frup (fast reticulum updater) , if interested ask and i'll share the link

Yeah I've been running the latest of both rns, lxmf and meshchat. I would say the routing problems are much worse since 1.0 release, probably because there are a bunch of nodes running older versions that do not support aes256
yes i think this is also another probable issue!
please everyone update to latest versions of all rns packages! :)
but i think xmesh is completely down at the moment... Failed loading page: Could not establish link to destination. today morning was working fine
OK, at least I'm not alone :) But I keep receiving it's announces, so must be a routing problem on the way to it.
I must say I am now able to reach a lot more nodes steadily. I disabled 8 TCPClientInterfaces and only kept one, guess which one... RMAP.WORLD

Not a lot of people keep nodes running consistently due to the still experimental nature of the Reticulum network, I guess... but I do appreciate when nodes stays up and there is maintenance done with clear messaging. It should be easy to do, but a lot of people maybe miss the fact that there is a lot of people trying to navigate to the various pages :)
yeah correct...same here, announces received but no link estabilishing! :D
VA2PTL :D rmap tcp server is connected to about other 50 servers with transport enabled, so with just 1 server most of the network is covered ;)
yes thomas, i agree on everything :)
propagation nodes, tcp servers and "public services" should have a stable connection to avoid problems to the whole network (rmap runs on a vps, idem this chat and the meteo bot)
goodnight reticulum friends, see you tomorrow!

Yep, all agreed. Even my main MeshChat client is web-based and permanently running on my home server, so it easily accessible from all my computers with a single identity. https://github.com/liamcottle/reticulum-meshchat/blob/master/docs/meshchat_on_docker.md
these may be useful to someone  https://codeberg.org/etux/Node_App_Template/src/branch/main
thank you thomas!! triyng to implement more chat functionality with a sql db as suggested by you, work in progress :)
That's amazing! Looking forward to seeing all the potential that can be unlocked by such a change! ;)

There is also the potential to associate the nickname with the identity if provided to the node (I think that was introduced in the latest version of MeshChat)... that would allow the user to not having to always fill in the nickname for every fresh new visit... (on another note, I am sending this via RNode interface going at 3.1Kbps 🚀)
avevo pensato ad una cosa simile, ma la pagina credo non riesca a leggere l'identity...vedo quel fingerprint ma devo ancora capire...
@fr4nk più tardi ci do un'occhiata e vedo se capisco come funziona, se riesco a farlo funzionare ti faccio sapere!
Going to bed now, chat tomorrow! Need to get some rest before the new work week begins!
it was me, goodnight guys! (we need the identity & nick binding, mandatory!!! :D)
buongiorno /good morning /buenos dias/ guten morgen/ bonjour :D
It looks like we have an input sanitisation tester here :D
Hi! Anyone from Saguenay, Qc, Canada in here? Testing rnode + Pi on the roof tonight, just in case!
Qua vedo le date in UTC, è corretto?
Ok thanks! Here in Italy there are 10:20 CEST..
